abstract: American officials say that Russia, by greatly escalating fighter jet encounters with American ships and planes in Central and Eastern Europe, is showing its anger over increased American military presence in area it sees as its own; Russia and NATO are embarking on more aggressive military maneuvers.
lead_paragraph: Obama administration officials interpreted three incidents involving fighter jets in the last month as a warning to stay out of the Baltics, but said that would not happen.

headline.main: Close Encounters With Jets Show Russia’s Anger at NATO Buildup, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Close Encounters With Jets Show Russia’s Anger at NATO Buildup, U.S. Says

snippet: Obama administration officials interpreted three incidents involving fighter jets in the last month as a warning to stay out of the Baltics, but said that would not happen.
